page.title: 06TYTHERINGTON QUARRY
page.content: The Company that owns Tytherington Quarry is{AMEY ROADSTONE CORPORATION {(A.R.C.).}The Quarry is about 100_120 acres. At the middle of the quarry 250 ft down on the 5th shelf is a large pool of water which collects in the quarry. Two million gallons of water is pumped out every day. To excavate the stone is blasted off the face twice a day, with the result 8_9 thousand tons of carboniferous limestone is brought down. Roads around the quarry are closed and traffic stopped. After the blasting stone is taken to the crusher,it is tipped down the shoot and goes on a conveyer belt. Large hammers smash the stone into smaller pieces. The main problems for the quarry are water and possible harm to local areas.
